Where Next For Apple?
ByAnna CoullingStock Markets

Published03/31/2022, 02:24 PM

Where Next For Apple?

View all comments (6)6

Anna Coulling
Articles(1367)|My Homepage

Follow

AAPL
1.76%

Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has been on a tear recently and the trend higher is a great example of the price action being supported by strong, healthy volume.
The question now is where is the move likely to pause.
In the following video, I consider the short term price objective as determined by the volume point of control.

Where Next For Apple?

articles.title: Nancy Tengler on Apple stock: ‚Äòit‚Äôs a must own‚Äô
articles.content:
Apple Inc shares (NASDAQ: AAPL) have recovered 17% in roughly two weeks but the opportunities continue be plenty for the iPhone maker, says Laffer Tengler CEO. Tengler regrets cutting her stake in Apple Inc According to Nancy Tengler, she‚Äôs cut her holding in Apple by 50% over the course of the pandemic ‚Äì a decision [‚Ä¶]

Since October 2021, EVgo stock‚Äôs six-month return has outperformed several of the world‚Äôs most popular EV and tech stocks: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA), Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F), NVIDIA ...

articles.title: If You Invested $1,000 In Apple Stock At Its Pandemic Low, Here's How Much You'd Have Now
articles.content:
Investors who bought stocks during the COVID-19 market crash in 2020 have generally experienced some big gains in the past two years. But there is no question some big-name stocks performed better than others since the pandemic bottom.
Apple's Big Run: One company that has been a great investment in the past two years has been iPhone maker Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL).
Fortunately for Apple investors, the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 didn‚Äôt negatively impact its business much at all.
At the beginning of 2020, Apple shares were trading at around $296. By the beginning of March, the stock was down to $282 after news of the coronavirus ...Full story available on Benzinga.com
